personal_info.nationality: Canadian (educated at McGill, originally from Canada)

professional_info.industry: Venture Capital / Startup Acceleration / Product Design
achievements: Currently building tools for YC partners, applicants, and founders as part of YC’s Applications Ops team.
Previously co-founded **Fairmount Studios**, building VR apps and games for the Meta Quest 2 through the Oculus Start Developer program.
Researched fintech competition and cooperation with Prof. Kwangjun An at McGill.
Served as sole TA for a master’s-level Intro to UX Design course at McGill while still an undergraduate.
Graduated from McGill with **Dean's Honour List**, $50K+ in prizes and scholarships.
Represented New Zealand at the National Model UN in New York, securing Honourable Delegation (top 100 out of 500).
Spearheaded M&A Trends & Emerging Markets division for **MergerSight Group**, contributing to analyses reaching 95,000+ monthly readers.

previous_education: McGill University – B.Comm in Computer Information Systems (2019 – 2022)
University of Cambridge – Study Abroad in Economics and Chinese Economics (2019)

recent_achievements: Promoted to Product Designer at YC in 2024.
Transitioned from associate role into design leadership within YC.
Previously built and shipped VR applications via Fairmount Studios.
conversation_starters: Ask about her work designing tools for YC’s applicants and partners.
Discuss lessons from co-founding Fairmount Studios and developing VR apps.
Bring up her teaching experience in UX/UI while still an undergrad.
Explore her interest in fintech strategy research and M&A trends.
notable_projects: YC Applications Ops product design tools
Fairmount Studios – VR apps for Meta Quest 2
McGill Consulting Association – co-founded partnerships and mentorship programs

credibility_indicators: Dean’s Honour List graduate at McGill with significant scholarships
Experience co-founding VR studio and teaching UX/UI
potential_red_flags: Early-career professional (experience concentrated within last ~4 years)
VR startup (Fairmount Studios) was short-lived (1 year, student-founded)
person_analysis.overview: Eve Bouffard is a Canadian product designer currently working at Y Combinator, where she builds tools for applicants, partners, and founders. She previously co-founded Fairmount Studios, a VR development startup, and held research and teaching roles at McGill University. With a strong academic track record, fintech research experience, and international exposure (Cambridge, Model UN), she blends technical product design expertise with a background in strategy, research, and leadership.
person_analysis.executive_summary: Eve Bouffard is an emerging product design leader at Y Combinator, combining hands-on experience in VR product development, fintech strategy research, and UX/UI teaching with a strong academic foundation at McGill and Cambridge. Her trajectory reflects a unique blend of design, strategy, and startup operations.
key_insights: Currently in a high-leverage role at YC, designing tools used by partners and founders.
Brings both design and strategy experience through fintech research and M&A analysis.
Early leadership experience through teaching and leading student organizations.
Strong international exposure (Cambridge, Model UN, McGill).
